intro: Armeria willkommii var. odorata, commonly known as the fragrant thrift, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its aromatic foliage and delicate blooms make it a valued ornamental plant in horticulture.
